key_title: Key to the genera of Verbenaceae

Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Verbenaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Verbenaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Calyx unequally and minutely 4- or 5-toothed; ovary 4-locular; fruit of four 1-celled stone-like seeds (mericarps)
Calyx 2-partite; ovary 2-locular; fruit a drupe, or two 1-celled stone-like seeds (mericarps) or by abortion only one
Erect or scrambling shrubs; calyx shallowly 2-lobed to subentire; corolla 5-lobed; fruit a purple to black spherical drupe
Prostrate herb, rooting at nodes; calyx deeply 2-lobed; corolla 4-lobed; fruit dry, of 2 (or 1 by abortion) mericarps
